runs.comm: short and wide, helped to third man for one
short, into the pads, easy single to square leg
back of a length, no room, pushed to mid-on
slogs, just plonks the front foot down and slogs, and is beaten by extra bounce outside off
back of a length, angled towards hips/ribs, pushed to mid-on
grips the wicket a bit, and he defends it uppishly into the leg side, gets a single
back of a length, outside off, pushed to cover
into the hips, played to short fine, Shiv fields, misses the direct hit, would have got GG had he hit
perfume ball. following his throat as he sways out of the line, left alone well. and the bee-like buzz starts in the crowd. Test-match like
and again, another one towards the throat, gets tall, on his toes, and defends, keeps it down
fuller this time, around off, punched to third man
back of a length, chest-bound, and he drops and runs, well negotiated
starts with a wide down the leg side, too much swing, posthumous swing
this is a wide outside off, Vijay tries to cut, but can't reach it
steered to third man, where Taylor fumbles and lets them come back for two
short and wide, tries to cut, extra bounce beats him, not much feet movement either
back of a length again, pushed to cover. Nothing to drive here

soft hands! soft hands! Lovely bouncer, not too short, and it rises still, towards the chest, he has to play at it because it is following him, but he takes the bottom hand off and it bounces in front of slip
drops and runs, gets in before mid-on can charge in

sharp, back of a length, into the ribs, big appeal as Ramdin takes it down the leg side. He reckons there is glove or bat handle involved, Taufel thinks it is thigh/waist. The shirt fluttered as it passed him, so a good call
and this one is not the proper bouncer, there is tennis-ball-like bounce, and it goes over his head
Pollard! Short ball again, doesn't rise much and Vijay plays the release shot, the pull, and it goes low towards Pollard at deep square, and he dives forward and gets his hands under it
worked away off the hips for a single
short ball, defended with an open face, towards point
short again, slight room to swing his arms, and he cuts it over point. Sammy's pace easier to negotiate. First boundary of the chase
wild swing, charges down and connects thin air
bouncer, sharpish, beats him, but it is the second bouncer of the over, and hence a no-ball. So no free-hit
short and wide, cut away to third man for one
lovely shot, full on the pads, and clipped away nicely, past square leg

after you! After you! Roach goes back for the short ball, gets a regulation edge as Gambhir is looking to withdraw, and neither Ramdin nor Sammy goes for it, it is between them, and high. Always keeper's catches, are those
looks to tip and run, and is sent back

what do you do with those? That's the literal perfume ball. Fast, short, chasing his nose, Gambhir jumps and tries to sway out of the way - he does nearly everything right - but it kisses the glove. Delivery No. 4.4, unplayable are thou
full and wide, too wide outside off
back of a length, pushed to cover
full outside off, definitely a plan for Rohit, who drives at it without any footwork, and is beaten
short, into the body, played to short fine
back of a length, just outside off, helped away to third man
slower ball, no feet from Rohit again as he hangs his bat out, the edge goes wide of slip and fine of third man
back of a length, bounces at it, Rohit looks stunned - as if it is not supposed to bounce at him
backing away here, Sammy stays back of a length, and follows him, played to point
slower ball after pushing him back into the crease, and no feet again, and the outside edge seems to carrying wide of Gayle, but he dives full length and saves at least a couple of runs
and he will bouncers too! Raina backs away, charges at him, and swings somewhere six inches under where the ball passes him
and again another bouncer, following him, and he is beaten on the pull. One for the over, now Raina can plonk the front foot down
well not quite, another short one, ribs-high this time, and a limp pull gets him a single
slower ball to Rohit again, definitely a plan, this time he manages to push it to sweeper-cover
back of a length, around off, pushed to cover
tucks him up again, inside edge onto the thigh pad, takes a single
poor umpiring, really poor, Raina moves too far across, this short ball passes over middle and leg, and Raina is inside the line. Hence a wide

slower ball, slower ball, and the plan has worked! And this is audacious, never seen this happen in recent memory! Rohit premeditates the paddle sweep, and the ball lobs off what he claims is his forearm, and Ramdin takes this head high. And Billy Bowden has given this out, but what is Rohit doing, he is arguing, and he is asking for a third-umpire call? Jeff Crowe is waiting for you, Rohit. And what about Billy? He has had an awful over after that poor wide call. Bowden also moves to Taufel to have a chat, and is reminded that the third umpire can intervene only if the catch is not clean
steered to third man for one
wide down the leg side
back of a length, pushed to cover
back of a length again, tucks him up
comes down the track, and cuts this in front of square
no feet, no feet! length ball outside off, and he plays inside the line of it

pulled away! That reminds Bravo of his pace, and he ideally should not be bowling bouncers against world-class batsmen. The other batsmen, though, haven't been able to remind him of that. This is murdered over mid-on
another bouncer, following him, he pulls as he takes the eyes off as he pulls and manages to keep it down
rare poor delivery, short, slow, down the leg side, with the fine leg up, even Raina won't miss this short one
backs away too early and misses this short ball outside off
slightly fuller, punched down the ground, and Bravo fields to his right, saves one run
length balls on the pads, flicked away for one
Pollard nearly pulls off a blinder. The ball stops at Raina, he checks the shot, and it is dying in front of him and and to his left, and he nearly makes it with his dive
pulled away, eyes not on it, but keeps it down
Raina breaks free! That's his area too, length ball, into the pads, and he slogs it over deep midwicket
poor bowling, angling way down the leg side with the fine leg up, and Raina capitalises, hitting it over the fielder
lovely shot! Backs away, gives him the charge, Pollard tries to squeeze in a full and wide one, he reaches for it and places it between point and short third. Game on still
full, outside off, doesn't time the drive well, hit to extra cover
tries the yorker, turns out to be low full toss, hit with an open face to deep point
slower short ball, keeps the pull down, gets a single to deep square
too high this bouncer is, and is called wide
back of a length, punched back to him, deflected towards extra cover by Taylor
top fielding by Pollard! Pulled awkwardly towards deep square, it's dying at him but he attacks it and he sees he can't make it but still takes it on a half-volley
short again, looks to upper-cut it, is beaten
flighted, length ball, pushed to long-on
yorker into the pads, helped to short fine for one
short and wide, cut away for one to sweeper-cover
slows this one down considerably, flighted outside off, beats his attempt at the late-cut
this is the shot he plays well, short and wide, and deliberately plays in the air and in front of square, over extra cover
slower ball again, but too wide outside off

that makes up for the two runs he fell short of the century by! Brings himself on ahead of Benn, and takes Raina out in his first over. Raina goes for the slog-sweep, and top-edges it down deep midwicket's throat. Not quite the length to slog-sweep, and there is extra bounce in this pitch
short outside off, Dhoni is beaten on the cut
this time he makes connection on the cut, gets a single
flat, fast, around off, defended
goes for the shot over midwicket, but it is too close for him, and although he connects it well, he doesn't get the elevation and hits it down midwicket's lap
big heave first ball, misses, is hit in front of stumps, but the umpire reckons there is an inside edge
hit powerfully down to long-off
fired into the pads, gets a single to fine leg
flighted around the pads, worked to midwicket for one
and he slog-sweeps and misses
one-handed sweep for six! Goes for the regulation sweep this time, and even though it bounces at him, he goes ahead with the shot and gets six
short ball, and he rocks back into the crease, and pulls this effortlessly for six. Is there a turnaround here?
full, on the pads, looks for the big shot over leg side, misses, is hit in the pad
poor delivery, length ball, into the pads, fine leg is up, Dhoni says, sweet as
short outside off, hit to cover inside the circle
Dhoniiii! Length ball, and he nonchalantly takes half a step down the track and launches it flat over long-on. Game is on here
opens the face, takes a single to backward point
looks to tuck him up with a short ball into the ribs, he works it around the corner for one
slower ball, aborts the big hit he is thinking of, and gets a single to long-off
misses out on a leg-side offering, gets a leg-bye
wide down the leg side, looking to tuck him, but angles it too far down
and again a wide, down the leg side again - 10th wide of the innings
slower ball, outfoxes him, but the mis-hit clears the midwicket in the circle
Short ball! Short ball! Into the ribs, and Yusuf is hurried into it and pulls it straight down deep fine leg's throat. No power in it, just helped along. He didn't have the time to impart power
yorker, hit straight to midwicket, Bhaj sends Dhoni back
back of a length, hit back to the bowler
slower bouncer, too good for a No. 8, and he swings way too early
Hinds has dropped Dhoni! Misjudges this mis-hit towards him at sweeper-cover, and then he ends up diving forward and spilling it
back of a length, close to his body, and he is beaten on the cut
yorker, worked away to deep square leg
short ball, backs away to try and hit, and gets the toe end of the bat for single to long-on
yorker outside off, hit to extra cover for one
Bhajji hits, and he connects it sweetly, backs away, is expecting the short ball, and smashes it over long-on
yorker outside leg stump, and it's a wide
specialist keeper! Slower bouncer, Dhoni gets a glove on it, and Ramdin dives full length to his left to save three runs
low full toss, and hit to long-off for one
inside edge for four, just short of being a yorker, and Dhoni tries the big shot, getting the fortunate edge
slower short one, Dhoni pulls, and is beaten by the pace
yorker, right on the money, middle and leg, and hit back to the bowler
Dhoni is still keeping India alive! Picks the slower ball early, it's a length ball, and he lofts it over square leg

Direct hit, game over! Bravo has not bowled or batted really well, but he makes it up with the fielding. Bhajji has hit this to long-on, straight enough of Bravo, to his left, but he comes around, picks it up with one hand and hits the stumps on the yorker length
hit powerfully over his head, but Pollard is very straight at long-off and keeps them down to one
yorker outside off, he has backed away too early
driven to long-off for one, but he has over-stepped
wide outside off, sees Bhaji backing away but he is too wide outside off
slower full toss, and it's wide again
length ball, outside edge, over keeper, and four more
harsh harsh call! Wide yorker outside off, and I thought it went inside the wide line, but Taufel stretches his arms
what is happening here? Another wide yorker, over the wide line
Roach will be a relived man! He offers him a low full toss after four consecutive wides, and this deserves to go for six, but Bhajji has mis-hit straight to long-on
short, into the body, Jadeja mis-hits the pull shot, gets a single
hot powerfully to extra cover, gets a single. Not quite the redemption
short ball, Nehra swings and misses
short ball, backs away and skies it to long-on
yorker, hit to long-off for one. Game over. Thanks for coming, India
short, into the body, rubbing it in, just one leg-bye
full ball, hit to long-off, and they erupt in the stands
